comments:
I was running this on Eclipse 3.0 M1

I selected a closed project in the resource view. I clicked on "Open Project" 
and after a while I got an error message saying look in the log file. I tries 
opening it again, and got an immediate return.
Then I noticed the project was open, but when I tried expanding the directory 
tree, all files and directories within the project displayed with blank names.

Here's the log output that I got:

Am transferring to Core as it looks like 
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.getReferencedProjects
is giving an NPE.  However, Johnathan, it might be helpful if you could tell 
us if you have any non-standard plug-ins installed.  And what is the 
resource /entax2 that it is looking for in a later crash?

Firstly, I got around the problem by restarting eclipse.
Secondly, entax2 is the one of my Java projects, files are kept in CVS.
Thridly, the plugins I have installed over and above the standard shipped ones 
are:
com.atlassw.tools.eclipse.checkstyle_3.1.0 (Runs checkstyle over my code, but 
not on entax2 project)
com.kuchhall.eclipse.whitespace - removes trailing whitespace, and does tab 
conversion.
com.objectlearn.jdt.j2ee - AKA Lomboz 2.1.0
XML Buddy 0.2.8
Oxygen XML editor 2.0.2.beta
Quantum 2.0.0 - A JDBC DB browser.
Soap Rawmsg 0.0.2 - On the fly calls to a SOAP server.
XMen 4.1 - Another XML editor.

Thinking about what happened, I may have tried running the open project command 
again before the first one had started/completed. I do know I was annoyed at 
the long delay in opening the project.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 36576 ***
